title: Four Corners: The Moonlight State
subject_group: Crime, Espionage, Justice, Police & Prisons/Police corruption
abstract: Episode of ABC TV program 'Four Corners' dealing with organised crime in Queensland.
description: Despite denials by the Minister for Local Government Russ Hinze, Police Commissioner Terence Lewis, and Police Minister, Bill Gunn, widespread police corruption is evident throughout Queensland. Brothels masquerading as massage parlours with illegal gambling inhouse and drug trafficking are shown. Persons prominent in the criminal activities are named. This program was a major contributor to the setting up of the Fitzgerald Enquiry into Corruption in Queensland. Presenter: Andrew Olle. Reporter: Chris Masters. Episode of the ABC TV program Four Corners, aired 11/5/1987.
